page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: IN THE{BRUNTON}AREA THERE ARE MANY SPECIES OF{BIRDS.BUZZARDS}AND{HERONS ARE RARELY SEEN.WE HAVE MANY{WOODED AREAS,WITH MIXED TYPES OF{TREES.}IT IS A{FARMING AREA.}IN THE AREA THERE ARE {HILLS,GRASS}AND{SCRUB}WHICH PROVIDE AN ENVIRONMENT FOR{NUMBERS}OF{ANIMALS, {SUCH AS MICE,VOLES,RABBITS,STOATS, {WEASELS,HARES,RED SQUIRRELS,FOXES}AND {DEER.}IN THIS AREA THERE ARE MANY DIFFERENT{TREES}SUCH AS{SCOTS PINE, {ELDER,SYCAMORE,HORSE CHESTNUT,ELM {AND OAK.}IN THE{AREA}THERE ARE QUITE A LOT OF{INSECTS.}THERE ARE{BUTTERFLIES, {MOTHS,HOUSE FLIES,BLUE BOTTLES,WOOD {LICE,BEES, WASPS,MIDGES, LADYBIRDS}AND BEETLES.THE MOST COMMON OF THE{INSECTS ARE{FLIES.}THERE IS A SITE OF SCIENTIFIC{INTEREST (MARSH ORCHIDS) NEAR{BRUNTON.
